intro: Scutellaria orientalis var. adscendens, commonly known as the ascending skullcap, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom during the summer months. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
